file_content.text: I underestimated Lord Drowl's commitment to suffering. He's already developing a new version of the Quell toxin.
The slaves are dying off in droves. Lord Drowl will have to entertain his perversions elsewhere.
Lord Drowl must be beside himself with glee. The infected slaves languish in terrible pain.
Lord Drowl will compensate you when you've finished poisoning the slaves.
Why are you here? You're doing Lord Drowl's bidding, not mine.
If I know Lord Drowl's tastes--which unfortunately, I do--he's sent you for the Quell toxin.
I'm helping him put down the slave revolt.
You're correct.
Do you truly understand what he's asked you to do?
Are you implying something, Sergeant?
What do you mean by that?
Not at all. Your group is... exactly what I was expecting.
My superior appreciates a particular sort of talent, that's all.
Then hand it over.
Impatient? Of course you are. My superior certainly knows how to choose his assistants.
What if I told you this experiment is pointless--that past studies have shown increased suffering has no impact on the speed of surrender?
This has nothing to do with accelerating the end of a rebellion. Lord Drowl simply takes perverse thrill in gratuitous suffering.
I'm sure Lord Drowl wouldn't appreciate these comments.
Does he know how you feel?
Don't get me wrong. Lord Drowl is very good at what he does--but he lets his personal bents impede our efficiency.
Nothing wrong with that.
It's a matter of efficiency. There's no good reason why our mission here must be prolonged.
You're putting me to sleep.
Don't you see? Lord Drowl compromises efficiency for his own twisted fixations.
I want this assignment over with. The faster this rebellion ends, the faster I'll be reassigned to more important work.
Serving Lord Drowl's bloodlust has stunted my career. If not for his inefficiency, I'd be a captain by now.
You'd still just be a meaningless Imperial drone.
A captain of nothing.
Perhaps--but a better-paid Imperial drone with more authority.
If you let others block your progress, you deserve to fail.
You're weak.
Why do you think we're having this discussion?
Can't you simply get reassigned somewhere else?
Find a new boss.
I can't go over Lord Drowl's head. He'd have mine on a pole if I tried anything.
What does this have to do with the job at hand?
What's your point?
Everything, if you're willing to help me.
You overestimate yourself.
I know my potential--just as I know who's holding me back from achieving it.
Sorry you've been held back.
I'm not looking for sympathy. I'm looking for an ally.
Lord Drowl's dosage of Quell toxin will have slaves writhing in agony for pointless weeks--during which this area will remain volatile.
I've prepared a dose that will kill the slaves efficiently--which is better for the Empire and for me. Will you deliver my dosage, instead?
I want these renegade slaves to pay for disobeying the Empire.
No, the slaves must suffer.
You're not merely prolonging the slaves' agony, but my own as well. Committed to your work, aren't you? Very well....
Take the Quell toxin and inject it into the slave camp's water filtration systems. See Lord Drowl for your payment when you're done.
Let's end this revolt efficiently and kill off these renegades.
A quick death is better.
Wonderful. It's the right thing for everyone. Well, almost everyone....
I'll give you a maximum dose of Quell toxin. Inject it into the slave camp's water filtration systems and see Lord Drowl afterward.
Not to be rude, but I work for a maniac and I don't have time to chat with you.
